name: Interact with the Bust L of Jamus statue

nodes.text: It's a bust, I can tell that much. I can't tell who it is, though.
Hmmm... there's no plaque, nothing to identify it. Compared to most of the artwork in this place, it seems crudely done.
So why isn't there a lot of dust on this bust like everywhere else? Looks like something has wiped the head clear.
It also looks as if the head isn't completely attached to the rest of the statue. It might be two separate sections.
Umph. It's marble, and I think it must be attached to the pedestal, because it doesn't seem to want to budge. However, the head wiggled a little when I tried to move it.
I can't even see it well enough to try. I'd probably knock it over on my own foot.
Let's see if this head comes off the body. No... but it does seem to rotate a little...
So if I just twist a little here...
There's that noise again. What IS that?
Sorry little guy, I know this must be a pain in the neck.
Let's twist this guy's neck, shall we?
A little turn of the head should do the trick - presto!
Open says me!
Let's see what happens if I rotate it again.
Yep, heard that weird grinding again. I must've undone whatever it is I did before?
On second thought, always best to keep secret doors closed. Wouldn't want something creeping into the halls of the school. Well, the above ground halls, that is.
Trust me, I won't! The last thing I want is to make a loud noise and have Terk come in here and bust me!
Don't worry, I wouldn't even try it. Not under these conditions, anyway!
Yes, there is an aura of magic to this bust. It's a minor sort of spell, thankfully not the sort that will bring the bust to life. If this guy started talking to me, I'd jump out of my skin.
I feel as if the magic on this bust is a sort of triggering spell to set something else in motion. There's some other object or person associated with this magic in some way.
The magic is clearly linked to the fake wall that opens to the Underground Corridor.
Okay, this feels like it's some sort of trigger for something. Stupid Sense Magic spell is worthless. Or maybe my skill is worthless. I guess I just need to practice more at it.
Okay, that was creepy. Turning the head must have triggered something nearby...
